author: stweil

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body: Hi **@stweil**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! In order for us to evaluate and accept your PR, we ask that you sign a contribution license agreement. It's all electronic and will take just minutes. I promise there's no faxing. https://cla.microsoft.com. TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: stweil
comments.body: The Travis CI tests are obviously broken...

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I restarted the test.  CLA is still required.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Hey @stweil, the Travis CI failure was fixed, could you please sync and rebase? That will get you the fix for the PR CI run.

comments.author: stweil
comments.body: Do you really need a signed CLA even for trivial PRs like this one? I'm not willing to sign English legal texts which are much longer than "my contribution may be used freely". So I'm sorry: either you rethink your process and take this PR as it is (without CLA), or you close the PR without using it.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @stweil I don't think CLA is required for this PR. Thanks for your contribution!

title: Fix some trivial typos in documentation
